contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Band | name = Dagö | image = | caption = | origin = | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Estonia]] | years_active = {{Start date|1998}}-2008, 2010-present | actual status = | genre = [[Folk rock]] | record_label = | us_distribution = | current_members = Lauri Saatpalu<br> Peeter Rebane<br> Raul Vaigla<br> Taavi Kerikmäe<br> Toomas Rull<br> Michael Gallagher<br> Petteri Hasa | past_members = Tiit Kikas | website = [http://www.dago-band.ee/sisu/index.php?lang=en Official website] }} {{for|the island|Hiiumaa}} '''Dagö''' is a [[folk rock]] band from [[Tallinn]], [[Estonia]]. Dagö was formed in 1998 by Lauri Saatpalu, Peeter Rebane and Tiit Kikas. Dagö is the old name of [[Hiiumaa]], an Estonian island. The band's first album, ''Dagö'', was released in 2000, and received the Folk/Ethno Album Of The Year award in Estonia. Toomas Rull ([[Drum kit|drums]]) and Raul Vaigla ([[Bass guitar|bass]]) joined the band soon after. In 2001, Dagö won first prize in the ''[[Midsummer]] Night’s Improvisational [[Festival]]'' in [[Pärnu]]. Tiit Kikas left the group in 2002, and producer and musician Kristo Kotkas became the “invisible member” of the band. The second album, ''Toiduklubi (Food Club)'', was released in the same year, and Taavi Kerikmäe, a [[keyboard instrument|keyboard]] player, joined the band soon after. Their third album, ''Hiired Tuules (Mice in the Wind)'', was released in 2003, and in the same year drummer Petteri Hasa also joined the band. The fourth album, ''Joonistatud mees (The Picture Perfect Man)'', was released in 2006. Also in 2006, the band were awarded the folk rock ''Group Of The Year award'' in Estonia.<ref>[http://www.estmusic.com/index.php?0113413 Estonian Music Awards 2004]</ref> The fifth album, ''Möödakarvapai (Smoothing Caress)'', was released in 2008,<ref>[http://www.last.fm/music/Dag%C3%B6/+wiki Dagö’s Biography]</ref> and soon after, the band announced that they were disbanding.<ref>[http://www.elu24.ee/?id=44829 Lauri Saatpalu interviewed by ''Raadio Uuno'']</ref> In autumn 2010 the band started recording again, with new members, and in March 2011 they released their sixth studio album, ''Plaan Delta''.<ref>[http://www.dago-band.ee/sisu/index.php?lang=et Dagö official page in Estonian]</ref> == Members == * Lauri Saatpalu (vocals) * Peeter Rebane (guitar) * Raul Vaigla (bass) * Taavi Kerikmäe (keyboards) * Toomas Rull (drums) * Petteri Hasa (drums) ==Albums== *2000: ''[[Dagö (album)|Dagö]]'' *2002: ''[[Toiduklubi]]'' *2003: ''[[Hiired tuules (album)|Hiired tuules]]'' *2006: ''[[Joonistatud mees]]'' *2008: ''[[Möödakarvapai]]'' *2011: ''[[Plaan Delta]]'' ==References== <references /> ==External links== * [http://www.dago-band.ee/sisu/index.php?lang=en Official website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dago}} [[Category:Musical groups established in 1998]] [[Category:Folk rock groups]] [[Category:Estonian rock music groups]] {{Estonia-band-stub}}
